text: Bottle... Pours deeply amber with copper highlights and a small, fleeting, white head. The aroma features tons of rich caramel and a light splash of young port. Full-bodied with soft carbonation. The flavor is bright, tart, fruity and malty. Finishes tart, tangy and fruity. I have no clue what fruits are in here, but they work. Bottle courtesy of landhoney!

Poured a muddled orange rust color with aromas of light wet wood, v8negar, some light fruit and wine. Flavors Marche the aromas spur and vinegar with some light port notes, and wet wood. Solid overall.

Poured from a bottle. 
Aroma is fruity with a faint citrus note and moderate pineapple and tropical fruit. Some light colored berry and stone fruit notes with a bit of pear. Light grape notes and hints of oak. Light alcohol spice. Light caramel malt notes. 
Pours a slightly hazy, reddish brown/ burnt auburn with medium small, somewhat thin, dark tan head that recedes to the edges where it lingers. Light lacing and medium small legs. 
Flavor is lightly acidic with a medium light sweetness. Medium light malt notes of caramel and light toasted bread. Rather fruity with light citrus, moderate tropical fruit, moderate grape and stone fruit, light pear, berry and cherry. Medium low bitterness. Light alcohol spice and light oak. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a very fruity and tasty beer. Im not usually a fan of darker, acidic beers but this tastes really light and fruity even if it is approaching an amber or brown color and has some malt presence. Oak is light, but complimentary and the alcohol is well hidden. Only lightly acidic.
Bottle thanks to Chow. Pours a clear orange with small off white head. The aroma is wood, port, and fruit. Medium mouth, strong booze, oak, light sour fruit, very good.
Bottle. Clear light Amber pour with a white head. Sour lemon aromas. Sour lemon and some sort of tangy yeasty cat urine note. Average body and mouthfeel.

Bottle shared by WW at Tommys bday share at Busy Bee. Pours a hazy amberish brown with a small off white head. Nose shows notes of oak, red wine, port, funk, light herbal notes. Flavor continues suit with heavy barrel influence with notes of port, spearmint, herbs, and funk. Quite different from most things this brewery makes.

bottle shared by tom10101, thanks bro! pours hazy golden orange with a small white cap showing minimal retention and lacing. oranges and spices, berry fruitiness, subtle floral citrus, mint, oak, doughy caramel, sweetened cranberry jam, very bretty along other bugs, winey, few boozy notes. light carbonation, medium body - very oily, lightly tart and oaky-winey-spicy finish. does not seem to be very close from its suggested style, but i found it to be very tasty and enjoyable.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy red with low beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of fruits, wild yeast, sourness. Taste is of fruits, bretts, sourness. Palate: Medium body. Soft carbonation. Overall: Good, well balanced.

Pours a hazy brown with no head and no lace. Not the best looking brew ever. Nose is of fruits, herbs and oak. Taste is lightly tart and fruity. Nothing really specific, though, just fruity. Body is medium and so is carbonation. Juicy/vinous. A good one but not a great one.

Bottle (750 ml) @ De Garde ++ tasting. From Thomas, thanks!

Appearance: Clear bright golden/amber with a small white head and little lacing. 

Aroma: Quite fruity (red fruits) with port notes, hints of perfume, oak and light caramel.

Taste: Moderately sour with red fruits, wine/port notes, oak and light caramel.

Palate: Medium body. Moderate carbonation. A tad winey mouthfeel. Mild fruity finish. 

Overall: Good yeasty sour ale. The alcohol is surprisingly well hidden. Its quite tasty and enjoyable.

Sample at the 2014 Infected Chimipalooza on 11/01/2014. Slightly hazed amber color with a medium off-white head that diminishes steadily. Short strings of lacing. Aroma of oak, fruit and yeast. Medium to full body with flavors of vinous oak, berries and earthy yeast. The finish is moderately tart with a port wine and berry aftertaste. Above average overall.
Bottle at Bobbys tasting. Pours amber off white head. Nose/taste of oak, port, berry and light sour fruit. Medium body.
Bottle. Brown pour with white head. Sweet dark fruit aromas, port, dark fruit tones. Light oak, port, some fruit flavors.
Lightly sour lightly acetic apple pear salt berries tannic astringency. Copper color. No head. Soft effervescence. Pretty cool.

On tap at the 1st anniversary - Pour light hazy amber with a light head. The aroma has toffee malt, tartness, berries, red bruit and port barrel sweetness. It has a fairly full body with light carbonation. It starts off tart, malty, berry heavy and some vinegar. The finish has port, woodiness and overall hides the 10% amazingly.

On tap at De Garde. Pours a cloudy brown color with a medium white head. A sour fruity nose, berries, vinous and wood. The flavor has not heat, seems quaffable, big oak and vinous notes, berries, sawdust, robust sour and sweetness. Lingering tannins and sweet barrel. Awesome beer.

Draft at De Garde, Tillamook. Pours a very cloudy medium yellow-orange, decent amount of off-white head. Aroma is very port-forward, but with some estery notes as well. Body is full and rich, not much vinous notes, but catching a hint of woody bite. Slight booziness at tail end, with some grain character as well. Different and tasty.
